title: X-Ray Computed Tomography at Idaho National Laboratory’s Irradiated Materials Characterization Laboratory
content: In today’s energy climate, nuclear power is an attractive option to meet the increasing worldwide energy demands as it is a carbon-free, energy-dense power source that can realistically meet global energy needs. However, new nuclear concepts must be rigorously tested, developed, and studied before they can be licensed for commercial use. Idaho National Laboratory (INL) is the US Department of Energy’s center for nuclear energy research and development and is tasked with helping enable the development and commercialization of novel nuclear concepts.
